page.title: 10Stirling Libraries & Museums
page.content:
Libraries: Money was donated by Andrew Carnegie to build the library which Mrs Carnegie opened in 1903. The sections of the library are: Reference, Commercial, Lending and Juvenile. The materials available are: Books, Magazines, Newspapers, Illus- trations, Records and Tapes. The books are arranged by Numerical order and Dewey Decimal classification system. The libraries membership totals 29712 including the 1012 members in the Audio library. There are around 69000 books in stock.
Museum: The Smith Museum and Art Gallery, is popular with both local residents and tourists. The building was designed and built in the 19th Century. Today various exhibitions, paintings and crafts are on display. Lectures are also given there.
